name: hal-9000
description: Complete Claude Code productivity suite: aod (Army of Darkness) multi-branch development, hal9000 containerized Claude, MCP servers (ChromaDB, Memory Bank, Sequential Thinking, DEVONthink), beads (bd) issue tracking, 12 custom agents, session management, terminal automation (tmux-cli), and safety hooks

chromadb.comment: This is a sample configuration. Users should configure via Claude UI after installation, or edit this file to use 'chroma-mcp' (relies on PATH) instead of absolute path.

devonthink.comment: Python-based minimal MCP server. Installed locally in mcp-servers/devonthink/

install.postInstall:
Installation complete! Please restart Claude Code to load all components.

Installed:
• MCP Servers: ChromaDB, Memory Bank, Sequential Thinking, DEVONthink
• beads (bd): Dependency-aware issue tracking for AI workflows
• Custom Agents: 12 specialized agents (java-developer, code-review-expert, etc.)
• Session Commands: /check, /load, /sessions, /session-delete
• Terminal Tools: tmux-cli, find-session, vault, env-safe
• Safety Hooks: Git, file, and environment protection
• aod (Army of Darkness): Multi-branch parallel development with git worktrees
• hal9000: Containerized Claude for isolated sessions

Next steps:
1. Configure ChromaDB environment variables (if using cloud mode)
2. Initialize beads: cd your-project && bd init
3. Try: aod --help, hal9000 --help, tmux-cli --help, bd --help
4. Test: /sessions, hal9000 run, aod-list, bd ready
5. See AGENTS.md for agent documentation
